meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The pots and pans were clanging loudly in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I heard the clanging of the church bells in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The clanging of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The clanging of swords filled the air as the knights clashed in battle.
meanings.sent5: The clanging of the hammer against the metal echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The clanging of the metal gate could be heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The sudden clanging startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The clanging of the wind chimes created a soothing melody in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The clanging of the fire alarm sent everyone into a panic.
meanings.sent5: The clanging of the cymbals added an exciting element to the music performance.
